data.meta_description: Jeremy Sisto is an American actor, producer and writer. He is best known for his role as Billy Chenowith on the hit HBO television series Six Feet
data.text:
Jeremy Sisto is an American actor, producer and writer. He is best known for his role as Billy Chenowith on the hit HBO television series Six Feet Under. The hugely successful HBO series ran from 2001 to 2005 and was nominated for SAG Awards for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series throughout its 5 seasons, winning the award for 2002 and 2003.

Jeremy Sisto is also recognized for his role as NYPD Detective Cyrus Lupo in the NBC crime drama series Law & Order. He joined the main cast of the hit series Law & Order from the 18th season through the 20th and final season. He starred in 3 seasons of the ABC sitcom Suburgatoire which ran from 2011 to 2014. He played lead character George Altman which earned him a Critics Choice TV Award nomination for Best Actor in a Comedy Series.

Jeremy Sisto has been very consistent throughout his long career. He starred in several movies such as Clueless (1995), Thirteen (2003), Waitress (2007) and also voiced a character in the 2017 animated adventure comedy Ferdinand. He also has a number of credits as a writer and producer.

Organic

Jeremy Merton Sisto was born on October 6, 1974 in Northern California, his mother Reedy Gibbs was an actress, while his father Richard Sisto was a musician and teacher. Just like Jeremy Sisto’s mother, his sister Meadow Sisto is also an actress. Sisto’s parents divorced when he was younger. His father remarried while his mother raised him and his sister.

Her early education was at Hayfield Montessori School in Louisville, Kentucky. At age 7, Sisto’s mother moved with her children to Chicago where he attended Francis W. Parker School. In high school, he worked in a few theaters in town. He was still a teenager when he landed his first role in the 1991 drama Grand Canyon. After graduating from high school, Jeremy Sisto went to the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA). His acting career took off after graduating from college.

Interim Professional Career

Jeremy Sisto starred in the 1995 cult classic Clueless. His first starring role in a major film was in the 1999 biblical historical film Jesus, in which he played the titular role. He also portrayed the titular role in the 2003 miniseries Julius Caesar.

The years 2001 to 2005 marked a high point in the career of Jeremy Sisto, in the hit series Six Feet Under. In 2002, the sensational actor was nominated for the Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle Award for his portrayal of the play. Take me.

He started his own production company Dima Entertainment in April 2003. Previously, Sisto served as producer for the 1998 film Taken, however, the film went unreleased. He made a comeback to the stage in 2006 when he was featured in the Broadway adaptation of the play. Festen at the Music Box theatre . The same year, he had a role in the drama series Kidnapped.

In 2007, Jeremy Sisto was featured on the comedy-drama film Waitress. 2008 marks a new high in Sisto’s career as a cast member of Law & Order in 2008 and remained until its season finale in 2010. He also voiced the role of Batman in the superhero animated film Justice League: The New Frontier.

From 2011 to 2014, the talented actor starred in the ABC sitcom Suburgatoire for which he received critical acclaim. He was nominated for the 2013 Critics’ Choice Award for Best Actor in a Comedy Series. Jeremy Sisto worked as a co-producer and co-writer on the 2014 indie comedy Flashpoint , in which he played a lead role.

2015 was a rather busy year for Sisto, who featured in numerous productions. The multi-talented actor featured in A&E’s drama series The Render which debuted in March 2015 but was canceled just after one season. He also lent his voice to the character Talon in the animated film Batman v/s Robin and also featured in the horror thriller film Executioner (2015).

Sisto is currently playing the role of Fredy Green in the crime drama series Ice Cream which was released in 2016 and renewed for a second season.

The net worth of Jeremy Sisto

For one who started his acting career at a very young age, Jeremy Sisto has come a long way. His Hollywood career spanned more than two decades, with numerous films and television productions to his credit. The actor and producer currently has a net worth of $6 million. For one who has remained stable in a very dynamic Hollywood industry, Jeremy Sisto’s net worth is even expected to increase in the near future.

Family, wife and children

Jeremy Sisto is currently married to former model Addie Lane. The couple married on October 13, 2009 in an informal ceremony at New York City Hall. Sisto and Addie Lane have 2 children together, a son and a daughter.

Prior to their marriage, the couple welcomed their first child, a daughter named Charlie-Ballerina Sisto on June 23, 2009. They also welcomed their second child, a son named Bastian Kick Sisto, on March 9, 2012 in Los Angeles.

Jeremy Sisto’s marriage to Addie Lane happens to be his 2nd marriage. It turns out that the actor was married before. On August 30, 1993, Sisto, then 18, entered into a marriage with 18-year-old actress Marisa Ryan. However, the marriage between the two 18-year-olds did not last. They separated just 2 days after the wedding and it was finally called off on June 20, 2002.
